extendedIngredients.name: balsamic vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 4 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar, You can use lemon which is what it is used traditionally
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar, You can use lemon which is what it is used traditionally
extendedIngredients.originalName: balsamic vinegar, You can use lemon which is what it is used traditionally

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 6-10 cloves of garlic, I use even more, we love it spicy and we love garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6-10 cloves of garlic, I use even more, we love it spicy and we love garlic
extendedIngredients.originalName: garlic, I use even more, we love it spicy and we love garlic

extendedIngredients.name: oil packed sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 - 2 cups of sun dried tomatoes in olive oil, drained.
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 - 2 cups of sun dried tomatoes in olive oil, drained.
extendedIngredients.originalName: sun dried tomatoes in olive oil, drained.

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.original: 2/4 to 3/4 cups of water, If it is to dry then add the remainder 1/4 cup, I always do

title: Sun Dried Tomato Hummus
instructions: In a food processor add half of the ingredients, 1 can of chickpeas, half the tomatoes, oil, water, vinegar and garlic. Pulse until smooth. Transfer to a big bowl. Do the same with the remainder of the ingredients and add the salt to this batch. Transfer to the bowl and combine with the first batch. Sprinkle the paprika on top. EnjoyTip: You can half the ingredients. Because we like it so much I have to make tons of it. Also, if you are using Tahini try to blend it first with the water, oil and lemon until smooth, then add the chick peas, tomatoes, garlic and salt.

steps.step: In a food processor add half of the ingredients, 1 can of chickpeas, half the tomatoes, oil, water, vinegar and garlic. Pulse until smooth.
Transfer to a big bowl. Do the same with the remainder of the ingredients and add the salt to this batch.
Transfer to the bowl and combine with the first batch. Sprinkle the paprika on top. Enjoy

Tip: You can half the ingredients. Because we like it so much I have to make tons of it. Also, if you are using Tahini try to blend it first with the water, oil and lemon until smooth, then add the chick peas, tomatoes, garlic and salt.
